There are naming inconsistencies in `eq_(path|sorted)(_in)` lemmas. :(
```coq
eq_path
     : forall (T : Type) (e e' : T -> T -> bool), e =2 e' -> path e =2 path e'

eq_path_in
```

It seems that both `all (mem s) s` and `all (pred_of_seq s) s` appear in goals, and then the above `all_seq` can be problematic. :(
```coq
Require Import all_ssreflect.

Lemma allss (T : eqType) (s : seq T) : all (mem s) s. Proof. exact/allP. Qed.

Goal forall (T : eqType) (x : T) s, all (pred_of_seq (x :: s)) (x :: s).
Proof.
move=> T x s.
Fail apply: allss. (* ! *)
exact: (allss _ (x :: s)).
Qed.
```
I think that the above `Fail apply:` reduces `pred_of_seq (x :: s)` to `(fun y => (y == x) || pred_of_seq s y)` first and then fails to unify it with `@mem _ (seq_predType _) _`.

review_discussion.author: pi8027
review_discussion.comment:
As in https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/pull/632#discussion_r520492284, `mkseq_nth` is useful to avoid induction here.
```coq
Lemma all_sort (T : Type) (P : {pred T}) (leT : rel T) s :
  all P (sort leT s) = all P s.
Proof.
case: s => // x s; move: (x :: s) => {s} s.
rewrite -(mkseq_nth x s) sort_map !all_map.
by apply: perm_all; rewrite perm_sort.
Qed.
```

review_discussion.author: chdoc
review_discussion.comment: 3 (short) lines rather than 6, that's much better. Also, the use of `mkseq_nth` makes it easier to find this should there ever be list membership without decidable equality in mathcomp. Great!

FTR, the behavior of this intro pattern has been changed between Coq 8.11 and Coq 8.12.ðŸ™

In Coq 8.11:
```
  perm_s12 : perm_eq s1 s2
  ============================
  sorted leT s1 -> sorted leT s2 -> perm_eq s1 s2 -> s1 = s2
```

In Coq 8.12:
```
  perm_s12 : perm_eq s1 s2
  ============================
  perm_eq s1 s2 -> sorted leT s1 -> sorted leT s2 -> s1 = s2
```

I'd rather keep `perm_sortP` untouched, and add
```coq
Lemma perm_sort_inP (T : eqType) (leT : rel T) (s1 s2 : seq T) :
  {in s1 &, total leT} -> {in s1 & &, transitive leT} ->
  {in s1 &, antisymmetric leT} ->
  reflect (sort leT s1 = sort leT s2) (perm_eq s1 s2).
Proof.
move=> /in2_sig leT_total /in3_sig leT_tr /in2_sig/(_ _ _ _)/val_inj leT_asym.
apply: (iffP idP) => s1s2; last by rewrite -(perm_sort leT) s1s2 perm_sort.
move: (s1s2); have /all_sigP[s1' ->] := allss s1.
have /all_sigP[{s1s2}s2 ->] : all (mem s1) s2 by rewrite -(perm_all _ s1s2).
by rewrite !sort_map => /(perm_map_inj val_inj) /(perm_sortP leT_total)->.
Qed.
```
